document.docAuthor: Bakker, Piet A. J. & Albano, Paolo G.
document.masterDocTitle: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

bibRefCitation.author: Koenen, A. von
bibRefCitation.refString: Koenen, A. von (1891) Das Norddeutsche Unter-Oligozan und seine Mollusken - Fauna III. Abhandlungen zur geologischen Specialkarte von Preussen und den Thuringischen Staaten, 10, 575 - 817.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Triforis elatior Koenen, 1891: 691
, pl. 45, fig. 5a, b, 6a, b, 7a, b.

Norephora ( Norephora ) elatior ( Koenen, 1891 )
—
Gründel 1975: 157
, fig. 7.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Germany , Lattorf , Calbe a/S., Atzendorf
.

Type material.
Type material not located so far.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Triphoris elegans Hinds, 1843
—E.A.
Smith 1884: 502
.
Triforis elegans ( Jousseaume, 1884 )
—
Tryon 1887: 189
, pl. 39, fig. 62.

Viriola ( Orbitophora ) elegans (Hinds, 1843)
—
Higo et al. 1999: 205
, G1665.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Straits of Malacca , 20 fathoms deep (
37 m
), mud
.

Remarks. Kosuge (1981) considered
Triforis flammulata Pease, 1861 a
synonym of
Triphoris ( Ino ) elegans Hinds, 1843
. Marshall (1983) considered
Euthymia tibialis Jousseaume, 1884
,
Triforis picturata G.B. Sowerby III, 1901
,
Triphora granti F. Baker & Spicer, 1935
,
Euthymella pannata Laseron 1958
and
Viriola ( Viriola ) kanamarui Kosuge, 1961
junior synonyms of
Triphoris ( Ino ) elegans Hinds, 1843
.
